title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live - BBC News
summary: investigation into st ann 's house fire .

text: parents call for stillborn law change

text: ex-soldier admits help for heroes fraud

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: east midlands weather update : a dry and clear evening ahead
text: it will be a mostly dry and fine end to the day , although a rogue shower is possible .
the skies will clear after dark allowing for temperatures to drop quickly .
tomorrow will be chilly to start with plenty of sunshine .
it will remain dry through the day but high cloud will turn the sunshine increasingly hazy during the afternoon .
temperatures will reach 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Anna Church
Weather Presenter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: man arrested over child sex abuse allegations
text: a 57-year-old man has been arrested on sus of non-recent child sexual abuse .
nottinghamshire police said they received information about serious child sexual abuse allegations .
an investigation has now been launched following an operation in clifton .
the man is in police custody .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man arrested after crash
text: a man has been arrested after a serious crash involving a car and a cyclist .
derbyshire police said the cyclist suffered a significant leg injury and is still in hospital .
the 23-year-old driver of a black bmw was also taken to hospital and later released .
he was later arrested on sus of drink driving and released under investigation .
it happened on tuesday at about 18:15 on sheffield road between chapel-en-le-frith and hope , near to rushup edge farm .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man stabbed in bicycle robbery
text: a man has been stabbed during a robbery in leicester this afternoon .
police believe the man in his 20s was attacked and robbed of his bicycle in glovers walk but he managed to walk to nearby holderness road where he collapsed .
he was then found at about 14:00 and taken to hospital .
his injuries are not thought to be life threatening .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester extremist posted views online
text: police have released some tweets posted by zameer ghumra that show his thoughts about the so-called islamic state .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man 'abused position of trust ' to encourage terrorism
text: the head of counter terrorism policing in the north east has spoken about the conviction of zameer ghumra .
the dissemination of terrorist publications is always a significant offence , but even more so in this case .
zameer ghumra willingly abused a position of trust , showing young children a violent and explicit beheading video with no regard for the profound effect the disturbing material may have on them .
that act alone is unforgivable . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rise in minor arson attacks
text: there has been an increase in the number of minor arson attacks according to nottinghamshire fire and rescue service .
figures show between april and june this year there were 380 small fires including bin and grass fires - which is up by almost 48 % for the same period last year .
station manager matt reavill said : `` secondary fires are a big issue for us a large portion of those are deliberate secondary fires things like grass fires do n't usually start themselves . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lane closed on the m1
text: worth knowing if you 're planning to use the m1 near long eaton this afternoon .
1 lane remains closed on # m1 northbound j24a-j25 , nr # longeaton , due to ongoing recovery of a broken down lorry .
severe delays back to j23 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: beheading video extremist found guilty
text: beheading video extremist found guilty

documents.title: investigation into house fire
text: a police investigation has begun into a house fire in st ann 's this morning .
nottinghamshire fire and rescue service were called at about 09:05 to a property in richmond avenue .
part of wells road was closed while crews from four nottinghamshire stations tackled the blaze , which took more than two hours to put out .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tranmere sign striker mcdonagh on loan
text: tranmere sign striker mcdonagh on loan

documents.title: rescue pony to compete in show
text: a pony which faced years of neglect is appearing in the horse of the year show today .
corkers who was rescued by the rspca in 2010 has been trained by emma mrvik , a solicitor from beeston .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: black mamba dealers jailed
text: two men have been jailed after pleading guilty to possessing a class b drug with intent to supply .
it 's after police searched a house on edensor square in the stockbrook area of derby and found a large quantity of synthetic cannabinoids , also known as black mamba .
police have said 37-year-old chris smith from edensor square and 38-year-old clint czernozukow from green lane were sentenced to 13 months imprisonment .
the pair were also ordered to pay a victim surcharge of £ 140 .

it has been well documented that these types of drugs have brought anti-social behaviour to the streets of derby and this action shows that we will take positive action against those using and dealing them . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county ins & outs
text: county ins & outs

documents.title: boys shown beheading videos
text: zameer ghumra told the boys of primary school age they had a duty to kill anyone who insulted their religion .
he taught them to fight with knives and toy guns and played them speeches from radical preachers .
the boys told the jury that ghumra tried to brainwash them .
one described how he used a phone to show them videos of people being beheaded .
they were `` horrible '' , `` disgusting '' , the boy said - but ghumra told him : `` if you truly love allah , you 'll do it '' .
ghumra also gave the boys business cards to recruit other children and invited them to travel out to iraq or syria with him .
ghumra 's been found guilty of encouraging the preparation , instigation , or commission of an act of terrorism and will be sentenced tomorrow .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: man killed himself after ex-partner stab
text: man killed himself after ex-partner stab

documents.title: breakingpharmacist guilty of 'terrorist propaganda '
text: leicester pharmacist zameer ghumra has been found guilty of disseminating `` terrorist propaganda '' at nottingham crown court .
it 's after the 38-year-old showed a beheading video to a child .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: car crashes into building
text: emergency services are dealing with a crash in thurmaston where a vehicle has collided with a building .
the car made contact with the door frame and porch of a property on nicklaus road .
the building was evacuated and the fire service was called to help remove a person trapped inside the car .
a request has been made for a building inspector to visit the scene .
more on this as we get it .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: oakham crash cleared
text: this was the crash causing disruption on burley park way in oakham earlier .
the vehicle has now been towed away and the road has fully reopened .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'families should talk about organ donation '
text: people in england will soon be subject to `` presumed consent '' when it comes to organ donation .
the prime minister made the announcement yesterday which means in the future people who do n't want their organs to be used will need to register to opt out .
but nicola pietrzyk from glenfield says it 's important that all families talk about organ donation .
her son matthew had a kidney transplant last year after a 10-year wait .

she said : `` although having an opt-out system is a really positive step it is still vital that you have a conversation with your next of kin and loved ones to let them know your wishes of being an organ donor so it does n't come as a shock . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hundreds of mourners attend adam johnson 's funeral
text: about 300 people are attending the funeral of 12-year-old adam johnson at markeaton crematorium .
adam died last month after falling through the roof of the aida bliss factory in chester green .
the derelict factory has been empty since 2004 .
author: Jonathan Baker
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: man killed self after stabbing ex-partner , inquest hears
text: a man fatally stabbed himself after attacking his former partner with a kitchen knife , an inquest has found .
warren hall , 25 , stabbed sandie rayne at a bungalow on holland crescent , ashby de la zouch , on 9 march .

ms rayne - who said she was shielding her daughter while she was being attacked - was found bleeding outside the property and rushed to hospital , and the body of mr hall was discovered in the kitchen .
carolyn hull , coroner for rutland and north leicestershire , said it `` appears conclusive '' mr hall `` died at his own hands '' after attacking ms rayne .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: a1 reopens after crash
text: the a1 between north muskham and tuxford has now reopened following a serious crash involving two cars .
it happened on the northbound stretch of the road near markham moor services at about 12:30am .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mourners gather for factory fall boy 's funeral
text: hundreds of people are already waiting to get inside markeaton crematorium for the funeral of 12-year-old adam johnson .
adam died after falling through the roof of the aida bliss factory in chester green last month .
author: Jonathan Baker
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: ceos to sleep rough for charity
text: bosses in nottinghamshire will be swapping their warm beds for sleeping bags tonight as they sleep rough to raise funds to combat homelessness .
about 100 senior managers will take part in the ceo sleepout at meadow lane - including alan hardy , chairman of notts county football club .

mr hardy said : `` last year there were 60 and we raised about £ 50,000 and this year there are about 100 and our target was to increase it by 50 % to get to £ 75,000 but i am hoping that everyone can raise at least £ 1,000 each ``
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brian blessed to receive honorary doctorate
text: actor brian blessed will receive an honorary doctorate from the university of derby for promoting conservation work in derbyshire .
the award will also recognise his involvement in the monsal trail in the peak district .
brian , 80 - who is best known for playing vultan in flash gordon - has worked for decades in film , television and theatre , including the royal shakespeare company .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: person in hospital after oakham crash
text: the burley park way bypass in oakham now has one lane open .
a patient has been taken to the queens medical centre in nottingham with injuries not thought to be serious .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : opening of 'memorial wood '
text: you 've been talking about bradgate park 's new `` memorial wood '' on our facebook page .
one feature that has divided opinion is the sale of bronze oak leafs that can be engraved to celebrate a wedding , birthday and anniversary , or to remember someone special .
gillian bates said : `` we walked around this wood yesterday and it is delightful .
very sympathetically done , well done bradgate park . ''
margaret schofield said : `` i would love to do that but how long would they be on there before some low life would weigh them in ? ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: your photos : sun in the east midlands
text: the sun 's out across the east midlands - and so are our wonderful photographers .
this was taken in chesterfield by viki the blue .
steve a captured this gleaming sun in kimberley .
finally this lovely view was sent in by craig the greenkeeper in birstall .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'memorial wood ' opens at bradgate park
text: a dedicated area for quiet reflection has opened at bradgate park known as the memorial wood .
people wanting to visit can follow a stone path to the area of woodland that overlooks cropston reservoir .
bradgate park is a special place for many people and one that is held close to the hearts of visitors and their families .
we have been able to dedicate an area for quiet reflection as the park 's memorial wood next to the main carriageway that crosses the park . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: evans 'focused and content ' with stags
text: evans 'focused and content ' with stags

documents.title: delving into the history of the forest lodge
text: goose fair is in town and the forest recreational ground is a sight to behold at the moment with a big wheel , rollercoasters and fairground stalls lit up at night .
on the hill overlooking it though there 's something else illuminated which will catch your eye .
the forest lodge was built in the 1800s when the park first opened and was originally used as a police station .
in recent years it has been restored by nottingham city council and head of parks eddie currie says the work uncovered some hidden history .

he said : `` we took away some panels and found this new entrance the function of this room may well have been straight off the prison yard into perhaps the reception desk and the booking-in room for people waiting to go into the cells . ''
author: Andy Whittaker
Presenter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: man convicted over 'revenge attack '
text: a man who carried out a `` revenge attack '' after his uncle was killed and then fled the country has been found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm with intent .
david glen-meade was however cleared of a charge of attempted murder .
the 24-year-old from chester avenue in leicester hit a 38-year-old man with his car on abbey park road in june last year .
the victim then spent weeks recovering in hospital after being left with `` life-changing injuries '' .
after the attack glen-meade flew out of the country but was arrested months later for other matters in amsterdam .
checks by the dutch authorities revealed he was wanted by leicestershire police and he was extradited back to the uk .
he 'll be sentenced on 6 november .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: st ann 's house fire : air ambulance called
text: the air ambulance is at a house fire in st ann 's .
crews from four stations across nottinghamshire have been called to the scene on richmond avenue .
wells road remains closed in both directions between woodborough road and the junction with ransom road and st bartholomews road .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather
text: watch : east midlands weather
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: derbyshire 's reece signs new deal
text: derbyshire 's reece signs new deal

documents.title: £ 9.4m grant for silk mill redevelopment
text: heritage lottery funding of £ 9.4m has been approved for the redevelopment of derby 's silk mill .
it will help create the museum of making which will open in 2020 in time for the 300 year celebration of the completion of the original silk mill .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash on oakham bypass
text: there 's been a crash on the a606 burley park way in oakham .
the road is closed with diversions through oakham and burley .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: road closed over house fire
text: a busy road in nottingham is closed because of a house fire in st ann 's way .
wells road between woodborough road and the junction with ransom road and st bartholomews road is shut .
fire crews were called to a property in richmond avenue at about 09:06 and are still dealing with the blaze .
new diversion on blue 40 , 41 with buses now serving st ann 's well road .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : road closures
text: just a quick reminder about the road closures in the county this morning .
drivers are facing delays of more than an hour on a stretch of the a1 .
the road is shut northbound between north muskham and tuxford because of a serious accident .
meanwhile in boston the a1121 is still closed at the junction at hubberts bridge .
the emergency services are still on the scene of a crash between a lorry and a car .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: crash causing delays on a6
text: this crash is causing some delays on the a6 st margaret 's way in leicester - it appears to have involved a car and a lorry .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: hinckley man talks of las vegas 'horror '
text: a man from hinckley has been talking to the bbc about getting caught up in the `` horror '' shooting in las vegas earlier this week .
ian payne was in the casino at the mgm grand with his wife and son when stephen paddock started shooting people from a hotel .
he was first aware of what was happening when people came rushing inside : `` there was screaming and there was crying .
there were big , big men that were terrified .
the way people came racing through that casino was like nothing i 'd ever seen before.the sheer panic and the sheer horror .
`` we just knew something awful had happened and people were shouting 'run , run , get away from here ' . ''
mr payne and his family went to a hotel room with a family from california who were trying to trace missing relatives .
several hours later they were allowed to leave the building and go to their own hotel .
the family are still in las vegas and said the atmosphere is `` getting calmer '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the weird and wonderful world of pub games
text: the weird and wonderful world of pub games
author: David Gilyeat
BBC News

documents.title: conservative party prankster to appear at nottingham 's glee club
text: the prankster who interrupted theresa may 's speech at the conservative party conference will appear in nottingham under his persona lee nelson .
simon brodkin presented mrs may with a p45 , saying it was from boris johnson .
mr brodkin who was released by police because he had accreditation for the conference will be on stage at the glee club this evening .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottinghamshire cricketer named player of year
text: samit patel has been named player of the year by the professional cricketers association players .
he is the first nottinghamshire player to be named since sir richard hadlee 30 years ago .
the 32-year-old pipped the retiring surrey batsman kumar sangakkara , glamorgan all-rounder colin ingram and essex seamer jamie porter to the prize .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: watch : tuneful protest about assembly rooms
text: around 40 people from arts and theatre groups in derby protested last night about the future of the assembly rooms in derby .
it was more tuneful than most protests you might have seen .
campaigners said they 're concerned the proposed new venue is n't big enough to host touring theatre productions .
at a meeting last night the council cabinet approved spending almost £ 500,000 to find an operator to run the new venue .
councillor martin rawson told the bbc it was a positive step and that the new venue could be a `` game changer '' when it comes to attracting people to the city .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: goose fair to officially open
text: the bells at goose fair will ring out at noon to mark the official opening of the annual fair .
about 500,000 people are expected to enjoy the sights , sounds and smells of goose fair at the forest recreation ground .
the fair is on until sunday evening .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police cuts blamed for atm thefts
text: the growing number of thefts of cash machines in leicestershire could be down to cuts in government funding , according to an expert in criminology .
fifteen atms have been stolen across the county in the last 18 months .
the latest attack happened at the co-op in countesthorpe in the early hours of yesterday morning .

dr john lamb from birmingham city university told the bbc : `` nationally this crime is no more likely to happen that others however there has been a rise in rural counties such as leicestershire over the last 12 months or so .
`` this is probably due to the specifics of those counties - they 're large , they 're rural and they 've seen significant police cuts . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car catches fire after police pursuit
text: police are looking for five people who fled from a car which crashed in sherwood rise yesterday afternoon .
the vauxhall corsa had earlier been chased by officers in gunthorpe drive but the pursuit was called off for safety reasons .
nottinghamshire police said the corsa then crashed into into a parked nissan juke in mayo road at about 16:30 and caught fire .
it was put out by police and members of the public .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new road could 'damage ' nature reserve
text: campaigners have raised concerns about plans to build a road through a nature reserve in mansfield .
the route at quarry lane would serve as the main way into a 200 new home site but the maun conservation group said the bridge over the nature reserve will damage it .
the group said there were better options for access .
developers said they were working on proposals to compliment rather than distract from the reserve and added that the overall development was a benefit to the local community .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: funeral for schoolboy who fell through factory roof
text: the funeral for 12-year-old adam johnson who died after falling from a factory roof in derby takes place today .
about 100 pupils from adams school in allestree are expected to attend the service at markeaton crematorium .
alan brady , head teacher of woodlands school , said : `` his tutor group talk about him every day .
in fact i think they 've decided to keep his chair clear . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new patient record system 'unsafe '
text: senior consultants at nottingham university hospitals have said a new patient record system is `` unsafe '' .
about £ 14m was spent on a programme to digitally scan existing data in an attempt to go paperless by 2021 .
the hospital trust insists patients have n't been put at risk but admits the current system does n't meet clinician 's needs .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a1 closed after two-car crash
text: the a1 between north muskham and tuxford remains closed following a serious crash .
it happened on the northbound side near markham moor services at about 12.30 .
nottinghamshire police said two cars were involved .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest on east midlands roads
text: nottinghamshire
derbyshire
leicestershire
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
amy woodfield and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
